EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
• Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
  Purpose: Automates conversion of raw ores into smelted products.  
  Consists of:  
  – Interconnected stone furnaces served by burner‑inserters and transport belts  
  – Wooden chests acting as buffer storage  
  – Belt groups that route smelted outputs to subsequent processing areas

• Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
  Purpose: Streamlines extraction of iron ore and its delivery to processing facilities.  
  Consists of:  
  – Burner‑mining drills extracting raw iron ore  
  – Networks of burner‑inserters, transport belts, and chests managing ore flow

• Steam Power Generation System  
  Purpose: Converts fuel and water into steam energy to power production.  
  Consists of:  
  – A boiler positioned at (8.0, 20.5) with connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5)  
  – Multiple steam engines deployed at positions (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5), and (4.5, 23.5)  
  – One extra steam engine remains unplaced due to persistent spatial congestion in the boiler zone (with overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts, especially around (8.0, 20.5) and (8.5, 22.5))

• Automation Research Lab  
  Purpose: Facilitates technology research through production of science packs.  
  Consists of:  
  – Laboratory units (noting intermittent power connectivity issues)

• Electricity, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure  
  Purpose: Provides the backbone for power distribution, material logistics, and fluid transfer.  
  Consists of:  
  – Multiple electricity groups managing power poles and network connectivity  
  – Belt groups interconnecting various production sectors  
  – Several PipeGroups forming distinct fluid routing systems

• Offshore Pump and Fluid Network  
  Purpose: Secures a reliable water supply for fluid‐dependent processes.  
  Consists of:  
  – An offshore pump located approximately at (0.5, 30.5)  
  – Associated PipeGroups that distribute water across the map

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
 - The extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to persistent spatial congestion in the boiler zone. Overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts (notably around (8.0, 20.5) and (8.5, 22.5)) continue to obstruct clear buildable space.  
 - Despite resource availability (1 steam engine in inventory), the cluttered layout prevents installation.  
 - Mitigation recommendations:  
   • Reevaluate the boiler zone and remove or reposition conflicting entities such as burner‑inserters and transport belts.  
   • Adjust adjoining connection interfaces to free up adequate space for extra entity placement.  
   • Consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area or redesigning the boiler layout to eliminate the bottleneck.
